9.question: What is the mode of transmission of Coronavirus?
options: through close and direct physical contact with infected bodily fluids, the most infectious being blood, faeces and vomit
via small respiratory droplets through sneezing, coughing, or when people interact with each other for some time in close proximity
When an infected animal bites or scratches you or when you handle animal waste.

options: Throughout the incubation and treatment time
Two days prior to the onset of symptoms and the symptomatic period

12.question: What is the kind of treatment given to CoronaVirus Patients?
options: Vaccine targeted to destroy the Virus
Supportive Care i.e help to keep the vital organ systems functioning

17.question: Which of the following is not a feature of Stage 3 of a global Pandemic?
options: The source of the infection becomes untraceable.
People without travel history get infected.
The spread becomes uncontrollable and major clusters of infection are formed.

18.question: RT-PCR test can be done on respiratory samples.The RT-PCR test performed with throat swabs is only reliable in the first week of the disease. Later on the virus can disappear in the throat while it continues to multiply in the lungs. What is the full form of RT PCR?

19.question: Ro or reproductive factor for corona is estimated to be between 1.5-3.5, What is reproductive factor?
options: The number of cases, on average, a viral strand will cause during its infectious period
The number of days in which an infected person will show symptoms
The number of cases, on average, an infected person will cause during their infectious period.
The number of protein strands required, on average, for the corona virus to reproduce in the host body
